recipe.title: Cookbook:Chimichurri
recipe.description: Chimichurri is a South American sauce for meats, consisting primarily of oil, vinegar, parsley, red chilli, and herbs. There are many different variants of chimichurri, and every cook will have their own private recipe. Chimichurri can be used as a marinade or sauce for grilled or roasted meats, or as a dipping sauce for empanadas.
ingredients: Depending on taste you can add any combination of the following:
½ green bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the oil, vinegar and water in a large bowl and mix together well, ensuring all the herbs and spices (especially the salt) are distributed evenly.
Bring the vinegar and water to the boil, add to the other ingredients and mix well. This helps to soften the taste of the onion and garlic.
Add the oil and mix well. If the liquid part doesn't cover the ingredients add oil water and vinegar in a 2:1:1 ratio to cover them.
Transfer to an air-tight container and refrigerate overnight at least, or better, for a few days.
When needed, remove from refrigerator about 30 minutes ahead of time to allow the oil to thin out again. Stir well and serve.
notes: For red chimichurri, use 50 ml red wine vinegar instead of white wine vinegar, and add 1 peeled, seeded, finely chopped tomato and ½ red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped, instead of green pepper.
